column4: how do i send stdout from a command (e.g. ls) to the stdin of another app? a tried "app < ls", but it doesn't work.
But it should almost never actually be used with "ls".
i need to send a list of files to some command
What command? What is your end goal?
the command is 'wallpaper', it returns a list of files which are suitable as wallpaper.
What is the *end* goal? Is wallpaper a command you wrote yourself?
nope, it's in the ubuntu repo; the end goal is to know which files are suitable as wallpapers.
wallpaper doesn't appear to accept filenames on stdin.
it accepts filenames as arguments, that's not the same as stdin?

No, it's not. Arguments are normally specified after the command name, like "wallpaper /path/to/foo.png", and must be specified before the command is even executed. stdin, by default, is input from the keyboard which can be given while the program is running.
oh i see; thanks for the explanation
You're welcome. I'm not sure how usefull this script will be though, it doesn't think that the default desktop background for Ubuntu 10.10 is a wallpaper.
You still haven't told me your end goal. What is it that you hope to accomplish?

ohh u mean the end end goal. i'm writing a little python script which sets wallpapers for the gnome desktop. i was thinking about an extra feature which only picks images that are close enough to a wallpaper (e.g. ignore pics with portrait ratio).

You should probably use wallpaper one file at a time, calling the command from python directly. Make sure to pass explicit values for the desired aspect ratio and other values as the defaults of the script probably won't match the needs of many users and should be configurable.
you are right; i was already playing around with the settings to get the right result.
